casebody.data:
The State of Ohio, Appellee, v. South, Appellant.

[Cite as State v. South, 120 Ohio St.3d 358, 2008-Ohio-6693.]

(No. 2008-0767 Submitted December 17, 2008 Decided December 24, 2008.) Alison Boggs, for appellant.

{¶ 1} The judgment of the court of appeals dismissing appellant’s appeal to that court for lack of a final, appealable order is reversed. The cause is remanded to the court of appeals to rule on the merits of appellant’s assignment of error.

Moyer, C.J., and Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton, O’Connor, O’Donnell, Lanzinger, and Cupp, JJ., concur.
